results.name: Triangle read by rows: a(m,m) = 1, for all m. For n < m, a(m,n) = a(m-1,n) + (sum of all terms in rows 1 through m-1).
comment: Row sums are A159925. Sum of all terms in rows 1 through m is A159926(m). A159926(m) - A159926(m-1) = A159925(m), for m >= 2.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..11476 (rows 1 <= n <= 150).
example: The sum of all these terms is 77. So adding 77 to each of the terms of the 4th row gets the fifth row: 22+77=99, 21+77=98, 17+77=94, 1+77=78, and the final terms is set at 1. So row 5 is: 99,98,94,78,1.
maple: A159924 := proc(n,m) option remember ; local s; if n = m then 1; else s := add(add(procname(r,c),c=1..r),r=1..n-1) ; procname(n-1,m)+s ; fi; end: for n from 1 to 13 do for m from 1 to n do printf("%d,",A159924(n,m)) ; od: od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 29 2009
